intro: Ampelozizyphus guaquirensis, commonly known as the Guaiquirá grapefruit, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color, similar to citrus fruits. It is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and unique characteristics, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
